node.title: Pence rolls out Republican policy agenda ahead of midterms
node.description: The former vice president hasn't ruled out a potential 2024 bid, despite former President Trump's criticism of him.

node.title: Russia bombards Ukraine cities despite promise to scale back
node.description: Russian forces bombarded the outskirts of Kyiv and a besieged city in northern Ukraine a day after promising to scale down operations there.

node.title: Transmission Gully opens: 'It's a lovely bit of road'
node.description: Transmission Gully is getting a thumbs up from motorists who put it to the test, and from people in coastal communities the traffic bypasses.

node.title: Ko lets go of 'perfect golf' before first major
node.description: Lydia Ko is looking at the big picture ahead of the first LPGA major of the year.

node.title: Phone counselling service calling for support after R&V donation cut
node.description: The cancellation of Rhythm & Vines is not just a setback for music fans - it's left a charity out of pocket. Audio

node.title: Cannabis seedlings weeded out of Parliament grounds
node.description: Cannabis seedlings have been found growing in Parliament's rose gardens today, with a groundskeeper confirming the plants had been raked up and destroyed along with the rest of the green waste.

node.title: Federal Reserve warns of "brewing U.S. housing bubble"
node.description: Economists say the pandemic housing boom is showing "signs of exuberance" akin to the boom of the early 2000s.

node.title: Maren Morris on "becoming fearless again"
node.description: Preview: The Grammy-nominated country music star tells "CBS Sunday Morning" that the last two years have made her stronger.

node.title: 'A classic': MCG farewells Australian cricket great Shane Warne
node.description: Thousands have gathered at the Melbourne Cricket Ground to remember Shane Warne, one of the game's finest players.

node.title: Property firm challenges FMA order in court over social media ads
node.description: A lawyer for local property firm Du Val Group has told the High Court its social media advertisements were not misleading.

node.title: More tenders advertised for controversial civic centre
node.description: Masterton District Council has put tenders out for four key roles in its $30 million civic facility project.

node.title: Forget the Fed and face your credit card debt now. Here's how.
node.description: "The sooner you can face the numbers and devise a plan to pay it down, the easier you'll breathe," one financial planner said.

node.title: Meningitis vaccine petition urges free access for under-16s
node.description: The parents of a teenager who died suddenly from meningitis have delivered a petition to MPs pleading for the government to fund vaccines against the disease.

node.title: Resident: Dozens of cases of rare brain tumor linked to N.J. high school
node.description: Al Lupiano started researching a connection when he and others family members were diagnosed as well.

node.title: Stephen Cox named recipient of the 2022 Grammy Music Educator Award
node.description: Stephen Cox was selected out of 1,135 initial nominations submissions from 49 states.

node.title: New "CBS Mornings" series explores the metaverse
node.description: To get a sense of what the metaverse is, "CBS Mornings" co-host Tony Dokoupil visited an existing piece of it — or at least his avatar did.

node.title: Watch Live: Biden updates country on actions to lower gas prices
node.description: The White House has said it's considering all options to try to mitigate the price at the pump.

node.title: "Everything is gone": Destructive tornadoes, storms tear through South
node.description: More than 100,000 homes and businesses are without power.​

node.title: French intel chief quits in suspected fallout for misjudging Putin's plan
node.description: As the U.S. predicted Russia was ready to invade Ukraine, France preferred to believe it wouldn't go that far.

node.title: Blue Origin launches 6 passengers to edge of space and back
node.description: The company has now launched four crewed New Shepard commercial space missions.

node.title: Voice from the grave haunts Ronald Greene's deadly arrest
node.description: Three years after Greene's death, Trooper Chris Hollingsworth's internal affairs interview stands as a defiant, haunting voice from the grave.

node.title: Russia seen regrouping in Ukraine after Putin "misjudged" his invasion
node.description: American and British officials say Putin was deluded, as a Ukrainian soldier tells CBS News his forces "don't have a strategy or tactics."

node.title: Jon Batiste on the healing power of music
node.description: Preview: The multiple Grammy-nominee and his partner, Suleika Jaouad, talk to "CBS Sunday Morning" about his music, her cancer battle, and the lullabies he composed to help her through pandemic isolation.

node.title: Few Americans file for jobless claims amid tight labor market
node.description: Some 202,000 people filed for jobless aid last week, an uptick after claims fell to a 50-year low.

node.title: Student jailed for spending almost $1M in student aid on luxury goods
node.description: A South African judge said the former accounting student spent almost $1,000 per day for months after a clerical error dumped the cash in her account.

node.title: Oil prices dip after report that Biden plans to tap petroleum reserve
node.description: Reports that the U.S. will release more crude from the nation's Strategic Petroleum Reserve could ease prices at the pump.

node.title: McCarthy rebukes Cawthorn over "orgy" and drug use remarks
node.description: The North Carolina congressman made the comments about the alleged behavior of members of Congress during a podcast interview last week.

node.title: Anti-death penalty activist marries Oklahoma death row inmate
node.description: Lea Rodger, 32, wed Richard Glossip, 59, who's narrowly escaped execution three times. It was the second time he's gotten married behind bars.

node.title: Ukrainian family stranded in Hawaii has "nowhere to go"
node.description: They are unsure if their house is still standing and say they are financially imperiled because their family business has been forced to close.

node.title: Will Smith was asked to leave the Oscars but refused, the Academy says
node.description: "Mr. Smith's actions at the 94th Oscars were a deeply shocking, traumatic event to witness in-person and on television," the Academy said in a statement Wednesday.
